comment: As best closer in Mariner history, carries little baggage, except for that which he tripped over (wink wink).
Never officially named closer by Mike Hargrove after replacing Eddie Guardado, so those 40 saves in 2007 might never have actually happened.
Might be considered Patient Zero when it comes to angst-inducing Mariners closers – or in Lou Piniella’s case, Impatient Zero.
On the short list of good Jack Zduriencik trades, acquiring Aardsma for Fabian Williamson – yes, THE Fabian Williamson – is in the upper half.
Needs to one day close for Oakland so The Bartender can become the BART-ender.
As a Nasty Boy helped win a title for Piniella, but never could replicate that feat in 3 Seattle stints with Lou.
Logan Morrison might still be looking for that last Rodney arrow.
By the end, “Every Day Eddie” had evolved into “Let’s Wait ‘Til Tomorrow Guardado.”
Forever grateful to A-Rod for bolting to Texas and wresting away “Most Hated Mariner” title.
Was known to playfully handcuff teammates to lockers, a technique Piniella borrowed for his relief staff.
Answer to trivia question, “Name last Mariner closer before Rodney to make the All-Star team.”
Had a long and fairly prosperous career as a starter after getting closing out of his system in Seattle.
Has to be considered second-greatest closer named Edwin in Mariners history.
Has to be considered best player sort of sharing name of superstar singer since Pirates’ Jim Morrison.
If it’s any consolation, fans in Cleveland have even worse memories of Mesa.
